thread.title: George Michael's escort ex-lover 'fears sex drug 'Liquid G' was behind singer's death'
thread.title_full: George Michael's escort ex-lover 'fears sex drug 'Liquid G' was behind singer's death'

author: Natalie Evans
title: George Michael's escort ex-lover 'fears sex drug 'Liquid G' was behind singer's death'
text:
George Michael's childhood friend thinks he was ' dragged back in to the dark side' Share this video 
Earlier this week, one of George's childhood friends also claimed drugs were behind his death . 
Andros Georgiou told the Victoria Derbyshire programme on Tuesday: "Hard drugs had been back in his life. 
"I just think he took too much of something, mixed with antidepressants and other drugs he was on - with alcohol. 
"I believe he had suicidal thoughts, because his mental health was all over the place. But I don't believe this was suicide," he added. Andros Georgiou has decided to speak out (Photo: BBC) 
"I think his heart just stopped beating." 
The ex-music producer, who fell out with the star in 1998, said he wanted "to get to the truth of what happened, exactly what was in his blood at the time, who gave it [the drugs] to him, why did he have it again." George Michael and 'cousin' Andros during the 1990s (Photo: ALPHA PHOTO PRESS AGENCY LTD.) Read More 
His theory is the latest development in a long line of twists surrounding the chart-topper's unexpected demise, which occurred on Christmas Day. Something which remains unexplained. 
It comes shortly after Georgiou made a public statement in social media, criticising George's boyfriend Fadi Fawaz. 
“I have been trying to hold back on this tweet I saw nearly 10 days ago but the more I am reading and the more I am finding out about Fadi I just can’t keep my mouth shut any longer,” he wrote. Andros recently hit out at celebrity hairstylist Fadi Fawaz (Photo: SMG) 
Andros went on to allege: “No 1: he was never with Yog 24 hours a day. They never lived together. He lived in one of Yog’s houses in Regent’s Park. Read More George Michael's lover says singer was so unhappy he became hooked on chocolate, pills and Coca-Cola 
“And even if they were, WHY were they not together on Christmas Eve? And why did he sleep in the car? Too many questions have come up.” 
Fadi has claimed he found George dead in bed at his Oxfordshire home after spending the night sleeping in his car. 
He later told The Mirror: "I never saw him that night. The police know everything. That’s the most important thing.” Fans and family alike have been mourning in public (Photo: REUTERS) 
Fadi has been questioned by police investigating George's death but there is no suggestion he's done anything wrong. 
He said recently the police had been very supportive and kind towards him, claiming: "They have done what normally happens when someone dies. 
"They have not been accusing me, never; they have been very supportive." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
